titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Dowe Van Dyne judgement 1977.097
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-09-21 13:37:22 +0000.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: A judgement issued by the Supreme Court of the State of New York against Dowe Van Dyne of Newtown, Queens County, dated September 15, 1783. The judgement indicts Van Dyne for "adhering to the Enemies of the State," and orders him to forfeit all real and personal property to the state, pursuant to an act of legislature.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Dowe Van Dyne judgement, 1977.097, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.
